body.name: VisionTek Radeon RX 550 4GB GDDR5 4K Monitor Graphics Card, 4X DisplayPort Outputs, PCI Express 3.0, DirectX 12, Bus-Powered - 901458
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 17 hrs 15 mins
Or fastest pickup Tomorrow, February 13. Order within 12 hrs 30 mins
features: 4x 4K at 60Hz DISPLAYS - Connect up to 4x 4K displays via HDMI 1.4. The outputs can power all displays to 4K at 60Hz simultaneously with support for features such as Radeon FreeSync 2
PCIe BUS-POWERED - Powered entirely by the PCIe 3.0 bus, this graphics card will no require any additional power connectors. (A minimum of 350W or greater system power supply is recommended)

RADEON FREESYNC 2 - FreeSync 2 allows your displays to vary their refresh rate in order to match the framerate of your AMD Graphics Card. It also supports high dynamic range (HDR), low framerate compensation, and low latency. (Must use Radeon FreeSync compatible displays to utilize features)
4GB GDDR5 MEMORY – 1500MHz memory clock and 1071Mhz core clock speeds with 128-bit memory bus
3 YEAR LIMITED WARRANTY - VisionTek is pleased to offer 3 year limited warranty when product is registered within 30 days of purchase
body.description: NEXT GENERATION GRAPHICSAMD Radeon RDNA architecture is engineered for the next generation of high-performance gaming. It's the DNA that powers your games, the DNA that brings your games to life, the DNA that keeps evolving.Take your gaming experience to the next level, experience stutter-free, tear-free gaming, reduced input latency and optimized drivers for new game releases with the AMD Radeon Software Adrenalin 2020 Edition.FidelityFX is a collection of high-quality post-process effects that automatically collapse multiple effects into fewer shader passes to reduce overhead and free up your GPU for the visceral experience you demand. Radeon Image Sharpening combines contrasts-adaptive sharpening with GPU upscaling to delivery crisp looking visuals with virtually no performance impact.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: VisionTek Radeon RX 550 4M - 4x DP, 4GB GDDR5 - 901458 Elevate Your System The VisionTek AMD Radeon RX 550 4M graphics card series is ideal for users looking to increase productivity by supporting up to four displays. Showcase your company with a multi-display video wall, install welcome monitors in separate rooms, improve workspace productivity or simply upgrade your monitor setup. VisonTek’s RX 550 4M graphics cards are the ideal low power multi-monitor solution.

Single Slot The RX 550 4M fits a full height system, taking up only 1 PCIe slot. Multi-Monitor Graphics Support for up to 4 DisplayPort Displays at resolutions up to 4k. Energy Efficient The RX 550 4M requires only 50 watts of power from the PCIe Bus. Recommended 350 watt or greater power supply.

Expand Your Vision Transform your computer from a standard desktop into a expanded workstation with VisionTek Multi-Monitor Graphics Cards. Connect up to 4 displays with support for resolutions up to 4K. Showcase your company with a multi-display video wall, install welcome monitors, restaurant signage, trade show displays, home theater setups, stock trading workstation or expand your home office monitor setup. Contents: RX 550 4M - 4x DP OS Support Windows 11 - 64-Bit EditionWindows 10 - 64-Bit EditionWindows 7 - 32-Bit EditionWindows 7 - 64-Bit EditionUbuntu x86 64-BitLinux x86_64

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works For Video Editing
reviews.reviewText: Unlike most users, I am not a gamer. I needed to upgrade the graphics card on my Dell XPS 8910 tower for the purposes of video editing using Davinci Resolve 17. The card that came with the unit did not support OpenCL and had only 2 GB of memory so the program would always fail when I tried to render even the simplest videos. So I was more interested in the ability of the GPU to support video and photo editing. From that perspective I am very happy. I was able to edit a half hour worth of 4K video without having to use proxy files and the video played smoothly while editing. And when it came to rendering, it worked flawlessly. Installation was very easy and the driver auto installed after a few minutes.Gamers may have other opinions, but as a video editor on a fairly simple set up, it has been well worth the money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars VisionTek Radeon RX 550 4GB GDDR5 4K Monitor Graphics Card
reviews.reviewText: My need are not much, I bought this card so I could have a 3 monitor set up. This card fits the build. As a matter of fact, the card will support 4 monitors and I believe I can still use the display ports on the mother board for a total of 6 monitors. Yes it was worth the price. Very pleased with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Don't buy this one
reviews.reviewText: I have nothing but computer crashes ever sins I install the garbage nothing like bean in a trade and the computer crash and your account goes to "0" I get error message AMD crash defender has detected an issue with your display driver, my driver is up to date.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Speed is not a factor for me, but driving three 1080p monitors is. This item works just fine. I have three 1080p monitors hooked to my new PC build for business. It works just as I had hoped. I see no delays or reasons to think this is slow in my world. If one is doing high speed complex gaming I suspect this would probably not be the card for you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars These stabilized all my studios monitors without video card meltdown
reviews.reviewText: These stabilized all my studio's monitors without video card meltdownI have about 10 monitors in my studio. 2 of them are 4K.This requires much graphic card power.I do instruction and so my images appear slowly.I could not recommend for gaming.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Horrible Card - DO NOT BUY
reviews.reviewText: Less than two months, the card has failed. Their tech support has given advice that further messed up our computer - having nothing to do with the card. The basic architecture of the Video card is bad - it CANNOT support FOUR HDMI outputs. The AMD software can mess card up! DO NOT BUY
